text: Hello, Elder Kenstn.
Hello, child. I see you've returned from work.
Did anything interesting happen?
The boss sent me to the higher floor.
He was sick, like you, so he sent me to his friend for some medicine.
But it seems he was in worse shape than he thought… I found him dead.
Oh, that's horrible. Hopefully his replacement will be as good as him, if not better.
But I doubt it. The people from up TOP want to see us suffer.
The more we work, the better it is for them. Being kind to us isn't part of their job description.
You know, I used to work up there, living the good life.
Then I tried to do something good for the people down here.
That's what got me sent here.
It must have been your first time up there.
How was it?
It was… strange.
The city felt lifeless and empty. I imagined it would be full of people and noise.
But everything was cleaner, newer… in much better condition than down here.
It's probably empty because they keep sending people from there down here to work.
I hope you enjoyed your stay, because you'll likely never return there.
A job that sends you to the higher floor is incredibly rare, and not given to just anyone.
Well, please don't tell anyone, especially Winston, but the security between floors was dead too.
I took a card that lets me go UP whenever I want.
Anyway, I came to ask, would you like the medicine I got for the boss? He won't be needing it anymore.
Are you sure you want to give it to me? You look sick yourself, child.
Much worse than earlier today, or yesterday.
Really? I feel great. Better than ever. I don't even feel the usual hunger anymore.
Interesting...
Well, in that case, I'll gladly accept your gift, but not for nothing.
Since you can go up again, take this combination I've kept in my memory for years.
It's for the laboratory. You'll find something useful there.
